# NSImageView.FrameStyle

**Enumeration**

Constants that allow you to specify the kind of frame bordering the image.

## Declaration

```swift
enum FrameStyle
```

## Overview

These constants are used by [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSImageCell/imageFrameStyle]. Note that some of these constants are stylistically obsolete and should be considered deprecated.

## Constants

- **NSImageView.FrameStyle.none**: An invisible frame
- **NSImageView.FrameStyle.photo**: A thin black outline and a dropped shadow.
- **NSImageView.FrameStyle.grayBezel**: A gray, concave bezel that makes the image look sunken.
- **NSImageView.FrameStyle.groove**: A thin groove that looks etched around the image.
- **NSImageView.FrameStyle.button**: A convex bezel that makes the image stand out in relief, like a button.

## Initializers

- **init(rawValue:)**

## Constants

- **NSImageAlignment**: Constants used by [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSImageCell/imageAlignment] that allow you to specify the location of the image in the frame.

## Conforms To

- BitwiseCopyable
- Equatable
- Hashable
- RawRepresentable
- Sendable
- SendableMetatype
